intro: Forsellesia pungens, commonly known as the spiny hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant features woody stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds, due to their bright colors and nectar-rich structure. Forsellesia pungens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
